Skill.label: Caustic Arrow + Pierce, Add Mirage Archer
Smoke Mine (Put detonate on left click)
Dash / Blink (If you don't like Smoke Mine)
Withering Step (Used for DPS Increase on boss)
Toxic Rain (Can also use TR MINES with Blastchain)
Malevolence, Drop Skitter (Wait if mana problems)

PathOfBuilding.Notes:
==================================================================================================================== GENERAL TIPS ==================================================================================================================== Bandits: Kill All
You get FREE respec points as you progress through the campaign. Use these to respec your starting Projectile Damage nodes (see 92 Point Trees)
The items in this guide are are a GUIDELINE, listed with the main core stats you're looking for. More/higher stats (resists, attributes, etc) are always better! They are mostly kept reasonable and obtainable through self-crafting methods post-Harvest nerfs
On trade leagues you can search for "Empty Suffixes" or "Empty Prefixes" with a value of 1 for items with open crafting slots
Upgrade your Pantheons
Keep an eye out on your Strength/Intelligence requirements, especially when adjusting your tree/replacing gear
We are scaling the Damage Over Time portion of Toxic Rain. We do not utilize stats like chaos leech or Adds X to X Chaos Damage
Ultimatum league is "Mediumcore". If you die in the encounter, you will lose the reward. A combination of strong defence and offence is your friend!
==================================================================================================================== 3.14 NERF ==================================================================================================================== Toxic Rain received a big change in 3.14: The spread range of spore pods from Toxic Rain is now affected by Area of Effect modifiers. This means that having higher Area of Effect causes the resulting spore pods to spread out more. The base spread range of the spore pods has also been slightly lowered. Each Spore Pod now applies 5% less Movement Speed to nearby Enemies (previously 10%), to a maximum of 30% (previously 60%).
This means that we no longer want to scale large amounts of aoe and might want to use concentrated effect for single target bossing/limit our amount of increased AOE I suggest continuing to level a Caustic Arrow early incase you want to run a 6L Caustic Arrow Endgame for additional damage
It is still most likely the best bow starting build in the game and capable of clearing all content. I have tried to adjust this guide to reflect the changes in 3.14
Trickster/Deadeye/Raider are all more competitive options, as Pathfinder mainly provided us with AOE/AOE scaling for Dying Sun through flask effect. Trickster - Decent damage/defense/utility Raider - Very strong defense/speed, built in ailment immunity Deadeye - More arrows/single target potential with 2x Mirage Totems
==================================================================================================================== GEM LINKS ==================================================================================================================== I suggest using Caustic Arrow for clear and Toxic Rain for single target until your Toxic Rain has enough damage/AOE to clear alone.
6L: Toxic Rain - Vicious Projectiles - Void Manipulation - Mirage Archer - Swift Affliction - Efficacy. Empower 4 > Efficacy only when you have late game bow. Maybe Concentrated Effect, will have to see the 3.14 changes in-game. 6L: Caustic Arrow - Arrow Nova - Vicious Projectiles - Void Manipulation - Swift Afflication - Damage on Full Life/Efficacy/Empower 3+, not Concentrated Effect as it decreases your clear 4L: Malevolence - Dread Banner - Vitality - Clarity 2L/2L: Cast When Damage Taken - Steelskin | Dash (Or mobility skill of your choice like Smoke Mine/Flame Dash) - Second Wind 4L: Spell Totem - Multiple Totems - Wither - Faster Casting or 3L/1L: Spell Totem - Multiple Totems - Wither | Despair
If you do not have a Despair on Hit Ring, drop Faster Casting from Spell Totem. DO NOT LINK DESPAIR WITH SPELL TOTEM
==================================================================================================================== SKILL GEM LOCATIONS ====================================================================================================================
---------- 1 - 12 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Caustic Arrow - Act 1 - Nessa - Enemy at the Gates Mirage Archer - Act 1 - Nessa - Mercy Mission
Smoke Mine - Act 1 - Nessa - The Caged Brute Dash - Act 1 - Nessa - Breaking Some Eggs Blink Arrow - Act 1 - Nessa - The Caged Brute
Puncture - Act 1 - Nessa - Breaking Some Eggs
Toxic Rain - Act 1 - Nessa - The Siren's Cadence (replaces Puncture) Void Manipulation - Act 1 - Nessa - The Caged Brute
---------- 12 - 24 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Withering Step - Act 1 - Nessa - The Caged Brute
Onslaught - Act 1 - Nessa - Mercy Mission
Vicious Projectiles - Act 2 - Yeena - Sharp and Cruel
Summon Skitterbots - Act 2 - Yeena - The Root of the Problem
Flesh and Stone - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
Blood Rage - Act 2 - Yeena - Intruders in Black
---------- 24 - 36 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Despair - Act 3 - Clarissa - Lost in Love Malevolence - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
---------- 36+ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Arrow Nova - Act 1 - Nessa - The Caged Brute
Spell Totem - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Wither - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
---------- Endgame ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Swift Affliction - Act 3 - Clarissa/Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Empower - Can only be acquired through drops or div cards, trade for it if you're not on SSF Efficacy - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Concentrated Effect - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
Damage on Full Life - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
Faster Casting - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Multiple Totems - Act 4 - Petarus & Vanja - The Eternal Nightmare
Dread Banner - Act 3 - Clarissa - Lost in Love Vitality - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Clarity - Act 3 - Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
Cast When Damage Taken - Act 4 - Petarus & Vanja - The Eternal Nightmare Steelskin - Act 1 - Nessa - Breaking Some Eggs
Second Wind - Act 3 - Clarissa/Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest) Flame Dash - Act 3 - Clarissa/Siosa - A Fixture of Fate (aka the Library quest)
==================================================================================================================== AURAS ==================================================================================================================== Malevolence Dread Banner Vitality Clarity (leveled to where it is comfortable for you)
Flesh and Stone had its mana reservation raised from 25% to 35% in 3.14. Dread Banner raises our evasion rating a lot and leaves us with mana to utilize other auras (Vitality/Clarity) Both of these auras give stats we desperately need
Can drop Vitality/Dread Banner later for: Aspect of the Spider
==================================================================================================================== FLASKS ==================================================================================================================== Seething Divine Life Flask of Staunching Enduring Mana Flask Quartz Flask of Warding Jade Flask of Reflexes Quicksilver Flask of Adrenaline
Replace Mana Flask with a damage flask like Dying Sun once you have solve your mana issues through ring crafts/other solutions
==================================================================================================================== MANA PROBLEMS ==================================================================================================================== Early game: Acquire a Enduring Mana Flask as soon as possible. You can craft Warding/Staunching on it with Bestiary if it is "Enduring Eternal Mana Flask" with no suffix This mod can be annoying to hit with Alterations on league start, so settle with what you get early since you have elemental ailment immunity (only need warding/staunching)
Clarity (DO NOT LEVEL IT TOO HIGH) Just level it high enough to have comfortable regen
Replica Conqueror's Efficiency can also help with mana cost and is a very common Heist unique
Mid/Late Game: Non-Channeling Skills have -# to Total Mana Cost (Elreon Unveil) prefix craft on Rings/Amulet can help mana costs more manageable This mod DOES scale with Fertile Catalysts. If you are crafting your own late game rings, you can catalyst them while they are still white/normal rarity (costs 4 catalysts only vs 20 once rare)
==================================================================================================================== KEEP DYING :( ==================================================================================================================== Make sure you have your Warding and Staunching flasks Make sure your resistances are capped Make sure you have a Jade Flask of Reflexes
==================================================================================================================== Anointment ==================================================================================================================== Early game - Freedom of Movement (Clear Sepia Violet) Aspect of the Eagle (Amber Verdant Verdant)
Mid/Late game - Corruption (Crimson Black Black)
==================================================================================================================== Optional Passive Nodes ==================================================================================================================== No Witnesses - Elusive nodes grant a lot of speed and defense while mapping. It is not helpful for bossing. You can drop these after atlas progression if you are looking to min-max for bossing.
Primal Spirit - Mana, Mana Regeneration, Strength, and Intelligence are all useful stats for us. Can drop if you have no problem with these stats.
Druidic Rite - Mana, Mana Regeneration, and nice flask QOL mods for mapping
Arcane Chemistry - Mana, mana flask recovery, flask effect, more nice flask QOL mods for mapping
==================================================================================================================== Midgame Bows ==================================================================================================================== 2 solid options:
-Quill Rain: Feels very smooth with Toxic Rain because of the high attack speed at the cost of more difficulty sustaining mana. It will also cause Caustic Arrow to deal less damage.
-Crafted Rare Bow: This is preferred if you're playing Caustic Arrow with Toxic Rain You can farm/buy a 6L Short Bow through the "The Porcupine" divination card (better base) or "Imperial Legacy" divination card. A Shrieking Essence of Dread (or higher) will give you +2 levels of socketed bow gems, hope for an open suffix (Either recraft with another essence or annul)) Craft Chaos Damage over Time Multiplier
You can unveil this modifier only from weapons dropped by It That Fled, which is not on the initial Sydicate board. You need to pick remove members from the syndicate until It That Fled appears.
==================================================================================================================== ADVANCED ==================================================================================================================== Crafting Life + Chaos Dot Multiplier Gear -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Many Rare items for this build have Life + Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier. You can craft a majority of this gear with Harvest Chaos/Chaos more likely rerolls, Aberrant Fossils, and Aberrant + Pristine Fossil Combo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Crafting Late Game Bow -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Around the point you can comfortably afford Empower 4 and have around 8+ exalts, you can seriously consider a sizable weapon upgrade. If you do not think you'll reach this amount of currency, you can go for a bow with +2 level of socketed bow gems and +1 level of socketed gems. However, it will not be that much better than a Quill Rain and the exalts are better saved.
Options 1/2: The bow you are aiming for is T1 DoT Multi, +1 to Level of Socketed Gems, Can have 3 additional crafted mods, crafted +2 to Level of Socketed Support Gems, and crafted % Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Ultimatum/0p4kV3gFg
Option 3: Same as above, but with tier 1 Attack Speed (6 Mod Perfect Bow) https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Ultimatum/8BQmzlMsV
You will need an uninfluenced 6L ilvl 82+ bow (86 for a very small chance at +2 arrows). Ideally, this would be a Thicket Bow You can either buy one (make sure it is ilvl 82+, no influence, not corrupted/mirrored/fractured) or link it yourself Remember that you can quality the base with Hillock in Transportation or with Perfect Fossils and craft quality on an item before 6 linking
1) Random suffix method (2 ex cheaper, can not gamble harvest augment speed/attack for a chance at a good 6th mod):
Spam alterations until you hit T1 DoT Multi while also aug/regaling good mods like T1/T2 attack speed or additional arrow(s) in case you hit Dot Multi on the augment/regal You're looking to annul down to T1 DoT Multi + any other suffix (If you do manage to hit T1/T2 Dot Multi + attack speed or additional arrow(s) on a rare bow (jackpot, VERY UNLIKELY), you'll want to suffixes can't be changed + scour to get rid of the prefix and skip to crafting Cannot roll attack mods) If you regal on only DoT Multi and hit a prefix, you can use the beast craft "Add a Suffix, Remove a Random Prefix" (Farric Lynx Alpha) to remove the prefix without gambling the 50/50 with an orb of annulment Result you want is two suffixes (Dot Multi + one random suffix), no prefixes Craft Cannot Roll Attack Mods Exalt! You will always hit +1 level of socketed gems since all the suffixes are filled Remove craft, Craft Can have 3 additional crafted mods, crafted +2 to Level of Socketed Support Gems, and crafted % Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier
Craftofexile emulator - https://pastebin.com/Dn3PktWS https://pastebin.com/Z7VFKWtV
2) Open suffix method (2 ex more expensive, leaves an open suffix to gamble for harvest augment speed/attack for a chance at a good mod, might not be worth depending on Harvest Augment/Fracture Prices)
Spam alterations until you hit T1 DoT Multi while also aug/regaling good mods like T1/T2 attack speed or additional arrow(s) in case you hit Dot Multi on the augment/regal (If you do manage to hit T1/T2 Dot Multi + attack speed or additional arrow(s) on a rare bow (jackpot, VERY UNLIKELY), you'll want to suffixes can't be changed + scour to get rid of the prefix and skip to crafting Cannot roll attack mods) Orb of Annulment until only T1 Dot Multi (start over if you annul it off) Once you have that, craft Can have 3 crafted mods (blocks a suffix so you can't exalt a bad suffix) Craft Cannot Roll Attack Mods Exalt! You will always hit +1 level of socketed gems since all the suffixes are filled Remove crafted mods, Recraft Can have 3 additional crafted mods, crafted +2 to Level of Socketed Support Gems, and crafted % Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier Augment speed for a decent chance to hit attack speed or augment attack for a lesser chance at attack speed with a small chance of additional arrow(s)
Craftofexile emulator - https://pastebin.com/S8xemd41
3) Fracture method (Best bow you can make, cost depends on price of Harvest Fractures due to Harvest nerfs in 3.14):
You can go for the same as above with a 6th T1 mod (attack speed is much easier than +2 arrows, as you can no longer imprint split +2 arrows) The simplest way to do this is use Deafening Essence of Zeal on ilvl 82+ Thicket Bow bases and Harvest fracture them (Note: Five Mod Fracture was substantially cheaper than 3 Mod Suffix in 3.13) Once you successfully fracture the attack speed (a fractured mod cannot be removed), the process is the same as above WITHOUT crafting Can have 3 crafted mods to block a suffix (Alt aug regal for T1 Dot Multi, annul off any extra mods, Craft Can have 3 additional crafted mods, crafted +2 to Level of Socketed Support Gems, and crafted % Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier)
Craftofexile emulator - https://pastebin.com/Wqrra0tq
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Crafting Amulet -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Harvest method for "Auging" +1 Chaos Gems was nerfed by the addition of a Chaos tag to Chaos Leech in 3.14. You are best off using Aberrant Fossils/Harvest Chaos More Likely reforges to craft your amulet.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Cluster Jewels -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1 Large Cluster setup is very strong/balanced endgame. 2 provides a lot of damage if you do not mind dropping a lot of life/have very good gear.
Large Cluster Options:
Chaos Large Cluster (8 Points) Good notables to look out for are at least two of Touch of Cruelty, Wicked Pall, and Unholy Grace. Ideally, you want 3 notables on your Large Cluster Jewel for good pathing
Crafting your own: Acquire 8 passive chaos large cluster jewel (preferably ilvl 50-67, helps with crafting but not necessary), reroll with Harvest more likely chaos or abberant fossils until 3 notables
Medium Cluster Options:
Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier (4 or 5 points): Wicked Pall
One of the following: Brush With Death Exposure Therapy Eternal Suffering Brewed for Potency Flow of Life Student of Decay (If going for Xibaqua Glorious Vanity setup)
After the Wicked Pall nerfs in 3.14, it's more in line with the other notables on the cluster jewel.
Crafting your own: Purchase 4 or 5 passive Chaos Damage Over Time Multiplier Cluster Jewel (at least ilvl 50). Harvest reforge chaos/more likely chaos or aberrant fossils until two desirable notables
**If Pathfinder**: Flask Effect Duration (4 or 5 points): Spiked Concoction - Grants Alchemist's Genius buff on flask use (20% flask effect) and 5% attack/cast speed
One of the following: Brewed for Potency - You want to ideally reach either 40/70/100% flask charges gained breakpoint (20% from ascendancy, 20% Primal Spirit, 20% Druidic Rite, 10% each Brewed from Potency) Peak Vigour Special Reserve
Crafting your own: Acquire 4 or 5 passive Flask Effect Duration Cluster Jewel (at least ilvl 50). Alt/aug/regal for spiked concoction and another usable notable, or use either harvest caster (better used for your hunter ring) or attack rerolls
Small Cluster Options:
Normal 3/4 Stat jewels % increased maximum life - Surging Vitality % increased armour - Enduring Composure - Generate endurance charges when hit. Nice for endurance charges during bossfights, allowing you to utilize immortal call % chance to Dodge Attack Hits - Elegant Form - 30% chance to avoid elemental ailments can help you reach 100% on ascendancies that do not have built-in immunity (Pathfinder and Raider have it already) % to Chaos Resistance - Student of Decay or a 3 passive % increased effect jewel can help you reach chaos resistance cap (for Xibaqua Glorious Vanity setup)
Tip: Remember that you can get resistances/attributes you need on Cluster Jewels. You can also swap/augment the resistances (suffixes) using Harvest
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Very Defensive Setup - Glorious Vanity Xibaqua -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- With Hardened Scars nerfed, this build definitely craves an additional layer of defense late game. Divine Flesh from the Glorious Vanity Xibaqua jewel can add a huge layer of mitigation to this build. You would place this jewel in the bottom left of Scion life wheel to convert Eternal Youth or bottom right to convert Supreme Ego. Make sure to respec Avatar of the Hunt if you are using Supreme Ego socket. There is a tree included to demonstrate this. However, this requires you to hit 80%+ chaos resistance through gear. YOU NEED TO BE CHAOS RESISTANCE CAPPED. Luckily, a lot of your gear crafted with Aberrant/Chaos rerolls will have Chaos Resistance. This was much easier with pre-nerf Harvest, but now requires a larger priority on chaos resistance gear, dual elemental/chaos resistance crafts, jewels, and Small Cluster Jewels. You can apply this to the two Cluster setup as well.
Finding a Xibaqua Glorious Vanity with good notables/small passives for your build can also be a fun way to min max your build. For example, you could find a jewel that replaces Profane Chemistry with one of these notables:
Cult of Chaos - +(13-19)% to Chaos Resistance +1% to maximum Chaos Resistance Exquisite Pain - (25-35)% increased Damage over Time (7-11)% increased Skill Effect Duration
Small Cluster Jewel: % to Chaos Resistance - Student of Decay or a 3 passive 25/35% increased effect jewel (no notable) with chaos resistance can help you reach chaos resistance cap You can craft this buy buying or alt aug regaling (ilvl 84 for 35%) for % increased effect and two non-notable prefixes (if you aug chaos with a prefix you can add a notable and lose value on 3rd small node) Augment Chaos on open suffix will hit a tier of Chaos Resistance (may be very low) Born of Chaos can be used to further push your Maximum Chaos Resistance for more mitigation. You ideally want chaos resistance on gear/other jewels so you can use 2x Born of Chaos 2 pt small clusters. The trees are made with a 3 passive chaos resist cluster for demonstration.
